diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Eosinophilic esophagitis, gastritis, enteritis, IgG Deficiency, PUD, Steroid Psychosis, Anemia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with severe nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and hematemesis, with a history of eosinophilic esophagitis and PUD. The recent episodes of hematemesis were more severe, accompanied by unusual epigastric pain radiating to the back. Evaluation through CT of the abdomen did not show free air but limited visualization due to extensive barium. These clinical presentations suggested acute pancreatitis.
